snippet: Schools are signing up to teach computer coding, which some view as a basic skill for today, and the tech industry-backed group Code.org is pushing basic coding even for the very young.
abstract: Schools across America are signing up to teach computer coding, which some view as basic skill for today, and tech industry-backed group Code.org is pushing basic coding even for the very young; trend to offer computer instruction is stark change for computer science, which for decades has been equated with trade classes like wood shop.
lead_paragraph: Schools are signing up to teach computer coding, which some view as a basic skill for today, and the tech industry-backed group Code.org is pushing basic coding even for the very young.

headline.main: Reading, Writing, Arithmetic, and Lately, Coding
headline.print_headline: Reading, Writing, Arithmetic, and Now Coding
